content.description: Starts with stemming between main rock and a block to the left.
content.location: Starts at the far corner left of Troll Romp.

content.description: Pitch-1: Climb Troll Romp (5.9). Pitch-2: Thin ballancy moves to the top (5.10c).
Juggy sprot route on an otherwise slabby chunk of rock.
content.location: First juggy route to the left of the popular slab climbs.

content.description: A long varied line up the center of Troll's Throne. Top anchors easily accessed to the upper most top section of Troll's Throne. Crux moves through the lower third.
content.location: Third route from left corner counting Troll Romp as the first.

content.description: Follow the bolt line to the top without crossing over to the bolt on Elf Magic (5.8). Mostly 5.8 to 5.9 climbing with an occasional 5.9+ slab friction toward the last third of the climb. Top anchors are easily accessed by taking the scramble trail that take off from the Baseline trail just past Trolls Thrown (climbs the hill between Trolls Thrown and School House Rocks.
content.location: From the walkway at the base of Troll's Throne, Studs will fourth boltline to your right and the fourth left from the right corner crack. From the top it will be the top anchor chains on the upper wall just right (looking out) from the madrone tree, not below the madrone tree (Elf Magic).

content.description: Ascend the small dihedral using the crack for protection. Near the top of the crack mover left finishing on Orc's Prow.
content.protection: bolts, gear to 1.5 inches, no chains on top anchors.
content.location: Far right corner crack at the end of the walkway.

climbs.name: Orc's Prow
climbs.fa: Greg Orton, Harold Hall, and Chandler Orton, 2002.

content.description: Begins with a neat thin mantel and step up onto the mantel (5.10b). First bolt is above the mantel and is high. Stick clip helpful. The next 20 feet off the mantel move through steep thin friction 5.10 b/c). Follow bolt line tying in to right corner with top anchors on top of the ridge just right of the corner (5.6). No chains.
content.protection: bolts, no chains on top anchors
content.location: on the walkway 2nd route to left from corner crack. First is corner route.

climbs.name: Ledge Culture
climbs.fa: Allen Kelly, Mike Heil, and David Goodman, 2003.

content.description: Once over the midway ledge, work your way up small edges to some delicate crux before moving left to a tricky exit to top anchors and chains.
content.location: next route to the right of Troll Romp climbs up the open slab.

content.description: climb the next hueco (5.7) to the right of the Elf Magic hueco. Follow bolt line (5.7-) to a slab mantel (5.8) crux move about 1/3 from the top then slab friction (5.7+) to the top. Top anchors are to left of the madrone (looking out).
content.location: on the walkway 3rd bolt line left from the corner crack (Nuts and Bolts). Counting the corner crack a the first.

content.description: Elf Magic begins at the left most large hueco. Climb through the hueco and follow bolts up the path of least resistance (5.7+) to the top between Studs of Rohan (5.9+) and Hobbits and Halflings (5.8+). There are chains on top or you can walk-off using the access trail.
content.location: From the walkway at the base of Troll's Throne, Elf Magic will fifth boltline to your right and the third left from the right corner crack. From the top it will be the top anchor chains on the upper wall below the madrone tree.

content.description: More quality sandstone cragging not far from Mind Planet. Many slabby climbs with a few jug hauls. The formation faces to the southeast but is surrounded by thick douglas fir forest, so it remains moist after rains for a day or two.
